title: Structure and Properties of Functionally Graded Mullite Environmental Barrier Coatings
content: The operating temperatures of gas turbines are becoming increasingly higher for improved efficiency and environmentally cleaner emissions. The currently used high temperature superalloys have reached their temperature limit, requiring increased use of silicon-based ceramics in the hot-sections of these gas turbines. These ceramics are susceptible to hot-corrosion and recession attack from the harsh environments, and thus require protective coatings.
